name: df-orng
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(corng, crab(s0, cin(crg, cogrp), wsbc(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(c0g, cv(s0)), wsbc(s3, cfv(cmulr, cv(s0)), wsbc(s4, cfv(cple, cv(s0)), wral(s5, cv(s1), wral(s6, cv(s1), wi(wa(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s4), cv(s5)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s4), cv(s6))), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s4), co(cv(s5), cv(s3), cv(s6))))))))))))
comment: Define class of all ordered rings. An ordered ring is a ring with a total ordering compatible with its operations. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Mar-2018.)
